title.value: Воспроизводительная способность и продуктивность коров при введении в рацион йодсодержащих препаратов
The reproductive capacity and performance of cows when administering iodine-containing preparations in diets

journal.title: Zootechnical Science of Belarus: collection of scientific papers

person.name: Pochkina, S.N., Belarus State Academy of Agriculture, Gorki (Belarus)

abstract.value: Scientifically-economic experience is lead in RUP

(Goretsk district of the Mogilyov area) in 2010-2011. It has been generated four groups of typical dry cows of the Belarus black-motley breed (on 11 heads in everyone): control and 3 skilled. Cows of control group received only the basic diet. To cows of 2 skilled group in addition to the basic diet iodemarin in a doze of 750 mkg on a head entered, to cows of 3 skilled group - Monoklavit-1 in a doze of 145 ml on a head, to cows of 4 skilled group - iodide potassium in a doze of 13 mg on a head. All animals received identical basic diet and were in identical conditions of the maintenance The studies helped to determine that the use of different iodine-containing preparations in the diets for dry cows allowed increasing milk performance. With that the use of the preparation made of organic iodine Monklavit-1 contributed to the positive effect on reproductive ability and milk performance of cows to a greater extent. For all period of experience animals in skilled groups had greater yields of milk in comparison with control group on 6,0% (P0,05), 8,4 (P0,05) and 2,8%, accordingly
